attributes.action: Give the A level 2021 students the choice to sit year 1 or year 2 content
attributes.additional_details: Year12s have felt isolated and are trepidated; this has been evident through the cries on social media. Me and many others found it difficult to study the enduring content alone; taking into account that many students don’t see the home as a suitable place of study; many being subject to domestic abuse, some have more responsibilities such as caring for a sick or disabled family member and has made it difficult for us to take advantage of the situation without libraries or face to face support.
attributes.background: This pandemic has disadvantaged those who have their A level exams next year, especially for those who may’ve suffered from in-house problems which has greatly affected our motivation and mindset to work. Parliament should make it a choice for A level students to sit their year 1 Or year 2 content

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Reduce curriculum content for year 10 & 12 students who will sit exams in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320772

Work with regulators and exam providers to clarify exam arrangements for 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312570

Cancel GCSEs and A Levels in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326066
